Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Megan J
Reviews.Content: Great hotel away from the hustle and noisy streets of Rome. Friendly, helpful staff. Wonderful breakfast! Rooms were very clean and well taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Option for Travelers”
Reviews.Author: mkl004
Reviews.Content: Quiet, small hotel off the beaten path. Good service and friendly staff. Excellent buffet breakfast included with price. But not located close to stores, other restaurants or tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: NAUgrad2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last night, and were very disappointed in many respects. The hotel is located in a residential area of Rome off of Via Salaria, and it's virtually impossible to find. We spent over 45 minutes circling the streets in the area, before finally stumbling upon it. After checking in, we were given a room on the second floor that overlooked a preschool. The room was okay, although it was very dark due to the heavy tapestry fabric that covered every wall. PROS: -Hotel does provide free ice, travel items (toothbrush, razors, etc) to guests -Nice down pillows, although be sure to ask for another one...they're not very plump. -Mini-fridge in room that you can store some items in. CONS: -Ridiculously hard to locate. -Parking is 15-25 euros per night, depending upon the season. -NO restaurants or shops within walking distance...eat before you arrive. (Do NOT eat at the bar in the hotel...my 10 euro pizza was a frozen pizza that had been microwaved.) -Unable to control room temperature...our room had to be approximately 75 degrees inside. -I didn't feel safe walking the streets...though it's a nicer area, I felt like I was more likely to be mugged on this side of town than I did in central Rome! -Front desk staff was rude and seemed unwilling to provide much information. I was completely unimpressed with this hotel. When we checked in, the clerk requested to keep our passports for 10-15 minutes. After 30 minutes had elapsed, we returned to the desk to pick up our passports and the clerk reluctantly handed them over. We asked for directions to a local restaurant and were told that there was a lovely one on the next street over. We walked over 4 miles trying to locate a restaurant in the neighborhood, and only came across 2 snack bars that served microwaved meals. So, I ordered a pizza from the bar at a cost of 10 euro. What I got was a frozen pizza that had been microwaved or just barely heated in an oven. I complained to the desk clerk and was told that I could get 10 euros worth of items from the minibar or a new pizza. When I stated that I didn't want either and requested 10 euros off of my parking fee instead, we went back and forth on it for several minutes. (Please understand, I checked into this hotel at 1600 and checked out at 0230 in order to catch an early morning flight at Fiumicino...I was hardly at the hotel!) Also, for the slighly accident prone like myself...the bathroom is a small step up from the main bedroom area. In the middle of the night, it's easy to stumble on this step. Be careful! I'm amazed the hotel was designed in this way. Bottom line: I would never stay here again, and will be notifying my travel agency about the poor experience I had at this hotel. (My travel package included this hotel as the final night before returning to the US.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krizt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rivoli for 4 nights (Six Nations) and the only negative point was that you have to pay an additional 12 Euros for using the gym. The rooms were clean and big enough. The breakfast was excellent (scrambled eggs were really fresh and tasty). The espresso is great too. Location is very quite and off center, but you can take a bus to the nearest metro station to bring you anywhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: PrincessZeltron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rivoli for our honeymoon in April 2011. We managed to find the Rivoli as part of a flight/hotel package. The hotel is small but very well kept. Our room was cleaned every day of our stay. I emailed them ahead of time and told them it was our honeymoon and they left a bottle of champagne in our room and upgraded us to a king sized bed for a very nominal amount. The bathroom was beautiful, completely made from granite or other stone material with full bathtub & shower, toilet and large sink. Lots of wonderful toiletries! We had a tiny balcony on which was a small table and two chairs, with a very distant view of St. Peter's. There is a tiny food store just a couple of streets west of the hotel if you walk down Bruni Buozzi. They don't speak a lot of English but they've got fantastic prosciutto, wine, olive oil, cheese and breads. Perfect for an intimate dinner on our little balcony. The hotel's location is a bit low key, in a nice little neighbourhood at the northern end of the large park where Villa Borghese and the zoo are. Via Taramelli is a tiny almost alley like road so don't be surprised if your taxi can't make it up to the front door of the hotel. It's literally a 30 second walk from the main street. There is an amazing restaurant just a 5 minute walk east of Via Taramelli on Bruno Buozzi called Pagaroma. They provide food AND champagne even before you order and it's all included with your meal. We ate there at least 2x if not 3 and everything we tried on the menu was absolutely delish! Continental breakfast was included with our room each morning. Best part was the little flaky pastries in the warmer each morning. Get there early. The rest of the breakfast was your typical continental offering at most european hotels. The closest major piazza is Piazza del Popolo, so you are going to do a bit of walking to get to any of the major sites. We walked to the Trevi Fountain in the evening, walked everywhere else too even though at the end of a long day it seemed like a long walk back to the hotel (uphill). All in all a fantastic experience for a less expensive hotel in Europe. If I had to stay there again I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatrickTC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst in Rome for the Six Nations Rugby, from Thursday 9th Feb 2012. The hotel is a little way out of the center, but if you're happy to walk to the tram (15 mins) or take the bus it's not a problem. There's also a nice walk from just past the tram stop (Ponte del Risorgimento bridge) along the river side - takes you quickly down the the Castle St Angelo, and beyond if you want. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were both good and there was a balcony too. The only minor criticism is the coffee - not sure what it was, but we skipped it after the first morning! We went to two great restaurants that were close by; Ambasciata d'Abruzzo (who provided a taxi to and from the hotel which was great because of all the snow and slush) and Carioca, which we went to twice.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: I booked a 1 night stay between stops. I made a mistake in reading the Travelocity review of the Hotel, and that how easily accessible it was. In the email received after booking under Hotel Policy, Cancellation Policy was to be 24 hours (1 day) before the check-in. I was 30 days from Checking In before I decided to Cancel. They went and charged me anyway. After I found out it was not only far away from the main Train station (Terminus), but it would cost over 60 Euros for a one way trip to and from the hotel by Cab , I decided to change hotels. Since I was arriving separately than my wife, we would need to spend over 150 Euros in taxi ( round trip between the two of us) for a 100$ hotel room, I decided to cancel. According to all the documentation they showed me and sent me, I was in my right to cancel. Well, they did not honor that. And when I called not only Travelocity did not help, nor Best Western, nor the hotel itself, and they refused to give me my money back, even though I have their written statement of their own policy. In fact the guy at the hotel, was not helpful at all; and he said it was time for him to go to sleep, when I called.. Huh? Anyway, fortunately my bank credited my account with the disputed amount. I showed them the documentation I had. Never again. Best Western Rivoli in Rome. Rob

Reviews.Title: “FAR AWAY From the train station”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a long trek from the train station. We took a bus and it took us a good 20 minutes. I would recomend a cab. The hotel is in a nice quiet neighborhood. Takes about 15 minutes to get to any subway tubes. The hotel staff were average at best. The room was nice and large. Good and reletivly cheap in room bar selection. The shower had a leak so our bathroom floor was always wet. We had a very nice litlle balcony. The room was the best part of the hotel. We slept well here. I would recomend learning the bus system. The hotel is in a neighborhood so cabs are scarce. For the price it was decent value.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Anecdotal
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before deciding to book this Hotel. And, frankly we loved it!! The rates were great value for the quality of room and amenities. Even as the location is a bit away from central Rome (Termini area)-its in a quiet neighbourhood and a cab fare of 12-15 euros from the Termini. Remember, that a similar hotel at the Termini area is available for double the rates of the Rivoli!! The room was in the 5th floor, and the lift was upto the 4th floor. But, then it was a plush carpet on the stairs and you don't mind alimbing it. The toiletries, tea/coffee facility in room, air condidtioning, linen, towels were all top -class. The room itself was small, but the bathroom was big, and the surprise was the private terrace area -which offers views of Rome and even the Basilica dome. Breakfast service was rather good and adequate. The only drawback is that it doesn't offer dinner at the restaurant...But, you can take a brief walk to the nearby restaurant that serves awesome Italain fare and wines. Go for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: JWH060
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel worked for us: the room (ground floor, 801) was comfortable and spacious, the bathroom nice, the breakfast extensive, the staff helpful, and the price we found on the Best Western site was better than many comparable hotels in Rome. Even though we're reasonably fit, however, we found it to be a very long walk to the main tourist attractions and ended up taking a lot of taxis. There is a city bus stop nearby, but for first-time visitors (we're Americans) it can be tricky to get up to speed in negotiating the local bus lines. There are a few fairly expensive, and good, restaurants near the hotel, but no neighborhood feel whatsoever; it's dead in the evenings. On the back side of the hotel, on the street parallel to Via Taramelli, is a little "tavola calda" with a very friendly owner, and one more street down from there is a snack bar--both good for quick and inexpensive meals. On the whole, for the price the Rivoli is a good buy, but I think if I went back to Rome again I'd pay more to stay closer to the heart of the old city, perhaps in Trastevere, Campo de Fiori, or the former Jewish quarter, so that I could walk out from my hotel more easily.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cotall55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Rivoli for six nights. It was a very good deal. The room was not large but it was clean and comfortable. Despite what others have said, the staff were exceptionally helpful particularly with recommendations and travel assistance. Travel to the City was easy as there are lots of bus & tram routes nearby. It was very quiet. Beware though it is difficult to find by car and parking is at a premium and expensive (simple, don't have a car, you don't need it). Breakfast was more than adequate with a lot of choice. The Auditorium is very near if you are into good music. We got a Roma Pass which was very good value as it included all transport. Available at the Airports and other places.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, ideal hotel for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Kunal G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Rome leg (5 days) of our tour. Its certainly not a 4 star hotel but value for money and very centrally located - villa borghese is at a fifteen minute walking distance and in case the weather is good, you can walk it to the Piaza de Popolo and the other tourist attractions, Vatican is a 20 min bus ride away. The bus stop is a minute away and very convenient. Apart from this they have a very helpful staff (ask for Manya - she knows the entire Rome inside out - be it places to eat, logistics, tourist attractions etc)!!! Only problem we encountered is that it does not have room service and not too many places to eat nearby - so either eat out or carry something with you.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In Rome”
Reviews.Author: rmarq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Rivoli after a 12 day cruise. The rate was excellent and a real value compared to other similar properties at twice the price. Clean rooms with exceptionally large bathroom with shower / tub combo that one just does not see in Rome. Extensive hot breakfast with coffee cakes and baked goods (plus eggs abd bacon) that were a deliscious surprise. The man and woman who took care of breakfast were tripping all over themselves to help seat us and offered a cappucino rather than the standard american coffee. The desk person at check in was very helpful and gave us some hints that got us into the Borghese Villa museum when they were sold out for days. The young man the next day was a bit aloof but over all he still answered our questions and we had a great stay. Two bus lines stop literally at the front door and the 910 bus that runs from Termini is just three blocks and 6 minutes away. There is no nearby subway stop but we prefer the buses where you can see Rome on your way to your destination rather than a black subway tunnel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tigerseye
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after seeing it included in a list of preferred properties by one of the tour operators we chose for this trip, as well as by reading the Tripadvisor reviews. Wow, was this a hit !! Off the beaten path to be sure, but after having stayed in the Termini area years ago, and knowing how crazy the city can be, we wanted something quieter and nicer for this visit. The staff were excellent, rooms were an amazing value and first class with all the modern amenities and smart touches; bathroom and beds were excellent, wireless internet service was free. And the balconies were a bonus. We knew that we would have to use taxis to get to our tourist locations or visit friends in the city, so just budgeted for 12-15 Euro trips each day; just be sure to have the hotel name and location (plus a map location) with you in case you get an inexperienced driver who only goes to the central Rome hotels. It is located close to the Vatican and that came in handy on the day there were police actions downtown, so we were able to get our tour operator to drop us there to pick up a taxi back to the hotel Breakfast buffets were great and we really appreciated them, though we would have liked an earlier weekday start than 7 AM, when we had to catch one very early morning tour without breakfast. We should have researched the restaurants in the hotel vicinity better before leaving for Rome, but otherwise we greatly enjoyed the hotel and will stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with work recently so, as I was only there for one night, I didn't really care about staying somewhere really flash. However, I felt happy when I booked given the reviews recently given. However, I feel as if I was staying in a different hotel! The staff were nonchalant (not unfriendly but really not helpful at all). I was put in a room that smelled awful and was covered carpet to ceiling in gaudy gold worn wallpaper that looked like it was put up in the 70s! Also it is difficult to get to. I would suggest choosing different acomomodation, particularly if you are coming on holiday to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, difficult to get to.”
Reviews.Author: bum_fluff1264
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel, however we did have some issues. Firstly, you can't get a bus from the train statton (Termini). You have to get the 192 bus which drops you off about 20 minutes walk away. Which is slightly up hill. The 52 bus does drop you off near the door, but you can only get it from near the Trevi Fountain. We eventually got the taxi on the last day which was so much easier. It only cost us €10. The hotel has lovely interior, though slightly dated. Our room was spacious with a great balcony. The large wide screen TV has plenty of channels. I did sleep really well though the guest in the room next door came in late one night and we could hear him having a shower. The beds are very comfortable but we had two single beds pushed together and the sheets and covers didn't fit the bed. Our room faced the road side, but the road was a cul-de-sac so it was nice and quiet. The evening staff, one who was very smelly, would barely acknowledge you when you walk past the desk. We had to ask for an extra pillow and when I laid down on it all I could smell was body odour. Clearly the porter had put the pillow underneath his arm to carry it. This was horrible, though funny looking back. Breakfast was good, with a big selection, including bacon and scrabbled eggs. Again, the breakfast staff didn't talk much and were rarely around. In fact, none of the staff at the hotel spoke to us during our stay, only when we wanted something. The AC in the room was great after a hot day's walking. And the fridge helped too. If I was to go Rome again, I would stay at a hotel which is near a Metro stop. The Metro is quicker, faster and more frequent than the bus, and as cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this hidden gem in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: Galila
Reviews.Content: This is THE hotel in Rome if you want to get the best out of a vacation/tour of this historical City. Here's why I really recommend the Rivoli...Rome is a very busy, crowded and loud City. All of the highlights are concentrated within walking distance from one another. At the end of a long day's sight-seeing - the Rivoli Hotel - located in the "Beverly Hills" (Pavioli) section of the City - is the perfect COMPLEMENTARY component to your Rome experience. Located in the heart of a residential neighborhood with ample and authentic neighborhood eateries, you get to feel and experience the local community - something you simply cannot do at a downtown hotel. The location is picturesque, safe and very quiet. This Best Western hotel is set at a high standard. The overall decor, rooms and public spaces are very tasteful. The rooms are large, well furnished and with the bonus of a private balcony! The breakfast buffet was ample and (another bonus) fresh Italian cappucino/espresso served to your table by the very friendly staff. You can stroll to Rome's "central park" nearby and transportation to and from the City is a breeze. Bus #52 to the city center (every 15 minutes) and #910 to the Vatican is around the corner from the hotel, and a taxi stand is also very close by - couldn't be easier! Take my advice on this recommendation - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a family of 3”
Reviews.Author: AmericanAngus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. The staff quickly replaced a bad lightbulb in our room, promptly provided ice when needed, and answered our questions in a professional and helpful manner. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, and my pillow was really comfy. The common area on our floor smelled strongly of cigarette smoke, but the room itself was free of odors. As others have noted, the location is away from the center, but there are buses that run nearby, though I could never locate a printed transportation schedule or map. The one day we planned to take the bus to the Vatican, there was a transportation strike (obviously not the hotel's fault), so we walked to the zoo in Villa Borghese, which my son had been begging to see anyway. From there we walked on into the city center, and "did" the Vatican the following day when the buses and metros were back in full service. On two occasions we took taxis from near the Trevi fountain back to the hotel, which cost almost 10 euro the first time and more like 7,50 euro the second time. The coffee at the hotel's breakfast is truly terrible, but you can ask for a nice cappuccino or similar and they will make it at the bar at no extra charge. The hotel arranged a taxi to Fuimicino airport and it was a flat rate of 50 euro for the three of us.

Reviews.Title: “By Rome standards, a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyingbutterwings
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Rome are renowned for having tiny rooms, uppity staff and a hot water situation that gives the impression that one small travel kettle if powering the whole thing. None of these issues affected the Hotel Best Western Rivoli. The location was lacking, in that it was a long way from anywhere, but taxis are fairlly cheap so this didn't pose much of a problem. Rooms were comfortabe and of a good size, bathrooms were a bit gauche but perfecty adequate with a great shower. Most importantly for Rome there was also plenty of hot water! The hotel is a great base from which to explore the city and fine for a short spell in Rome. Although next time I may look to stay a touch closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: wfatom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in mid-May. We attended a large wedding in Rome, and our friends stayed in 3,4, and 5 star hotels all over the city. Although other places were recommended, I chose the Rivoli due it's location in Parioli, and my good experiences staying in Best Western affiliated hotels in Europe. Also, as a retired military officer, they offered me a good rate, an upgrade to a superior room, and a free minibar. For us, the location was great-in a quiet, upscale neighborhood on the northside of Rome's largest and most beautiful park, the Villa Borghese. The nearest bus stop is a one minute walk, and the number 52 bus runs every 15 minutes and takes you right down the Via Veneto to the Via Corso near the Piazza Novona in 15 minutes. The alternative is a pleasant 20 minute walk through the Villa Borghese to the public transportation on the south side of the park. We used taxis every evening returning from wedding events after midnight, and the hotel's location out of the crowded tourist zones was a plus. Virtually no traffic ensured we were never more than a 10 minute cab drive back to the hotel, and we could always catch a taxi from the hotel without waiting. The rooms were beautifully decorated, large by Roman standards, with a huge marble bathroom with two sinks, two spa type showers, and a bidet. The walls were thick and we never had a problem with traffic noise or from other hotel guests. The staff were friendly, helped us map out our daily itinerary, and were all a wealth of information. The breakfast was good, not great, and the hotel had a computer for guest's use and free Wi-Fi. The hotel also has nice common areas and a beautiful patio area outside. Based on conversations with our friends, we definitely had the best value hotel. My only regret is we did not have the time to explore more of the Parioli neighborhood around the hoteI. If you are looking for a quiet hotel in a nice part of town with easy access to the tourist sites without all the accompanying tourists, the Rivoli is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Flipflop_ro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the Easter holiday in April and highly enjoyed. The hotel is located in a very nice residential area with embassies and beautiful Italian architecture. Nice room, large bathroom, a bit poor breakfast, but ok. The room has a balcony which proved to be a nice place to rest and have a drink in the evening. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor location but HORRIBLE staff”
Reviews.Author: aurorabrchicago13
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel cause I've stayed near Termini before and the area was just so filthy and crime-ridden that I couldn't stand to be near it. For $150 a night at the Rivoli, we got a room that was HUGE for modern Roman standards with a great outdoor seating area overlooking the city. The bathroom was enormous and filled with spa goodies. The location is residential and quiet but quite inconvenient because cabs in Rome are sooo expensive and the nearest Metro stop is a 10-15 minute walk through the filthy pooped filled streets of Rome. Only two dining options within walking distance. But it would have still been a more pleasant stay if the reception desk would have been more helpful. One staffer in particular (name starts with a P and ends with an O) said "I don't know" enough times to become a running joke for me and my husband the rest of the vacation. He spoke English but couldn't help with anything, reservations, recommendations, directions. In fact, when I asked where we could purchase a camera he literally said "Walk down the busy street, you'll find a store." HA. Breakfast was adequate but served by a sour-pussed waiter. I told my husband that IF I EVER went back to Rome, I would stay near Termini which is terrifying at night but Termini is the station that connects you to every area you want to be in while in Rome. It's too bad this hotel couldn't be better located and better staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay....super nice staff and very clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1bsymom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 10 day stay at Hotel Rivoli. Although it is out of the hustle and bustle of Rome it is a nice place to relax in the evening. Rome is a very noisy city. It was nice to come to a quiet place in the evening. The hotel staff was awesome, especially Monia at the front desk and Jenny in the breakfast room. The room we stayed is was very clean. The shower was great. It had a lot of water pressure. Like most hotels in Europe there were no wash clothes but they were available from the front desk. The rooms have a nice little balcony with a table and chairs. We sat out there every night with a bottle of wine. The breakfast is included and had your standard European breakfast of meats, cheeses, breads and pastries. It also had juices, milk, eggs, cereal, different types of yogurt, fresh fruit and coffee. The hotel has a few restaurants in walking distance and a great little grocery store behind it. It is on a a bus route and we had no problem catching the bus to go anywhere in the city. This hotel was currenty remodeling the outside patios....it looked like it was going to be really nice. All new patio furntiure was delivered while we were there. I would definitely stay again. Thanks for a great stay Hotel Rivoli!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Aquaniquerosie
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at this hotel from the 19th through the 23rd of September, 2010. I had checked out many hotels online and found that this hotel, in particular, had the most value for the money. There were things that were not to our liking such as the hot water problem. We tried in the early mornng, afternoon and evenings to take a hot shower. The three of us, in total, accomplished this once. We contacted the front desk and they told us what to do. It really did not work so we just made the most of it and figured that it was for a short time and we would survive. The hotel staff, including the front desk and especially one of the maids were super. The maid is from the Philippines and so helpful and friendly. We just loved seeing her in the morning for breakfast, which, by the way, was great. She always had a smile and ready to help. Just perfect. She is truly an asset to this hotel. The breakfast included eggs, bacon (Italian), ham, coldcuts, cheeses, cereal, rolls, juice, fresh fruit and pineapple (not fresh, but delicious) and ALL kinds of coffee. Any type you desired. It was all delicious/ As for the location, it is a bit off the beaten track but in a beautiful location. We were able to get around, without transportation, and found some nice shopping areas and restaurants. The front desk had given us the names of three restaurants in particular and we were pleased with just one of them. In fact, we had dinner and lunch there twice. This restaurant is about 15 minute walking distance from the hotel but worth the trip. The name of it is Taverna Rossini. The house wine (red) is to die for and the service and food are the same. We did go to a very exclusive restaurant nearby before going to the Taverna Rossini. The name of this restaurant is Pagaroma. It was expensive, they had no house wine, only very expensive wine, AND if you were not a local and rich, forgetaboutit!!! The service stunk and you were completely ignored. The food and service were not worth the mega amounts of Euro that this place costs. Another restaurant that we went to on our first night at the hotel was Ambasciata D'Abbruzzo. No house wine and since we did not want to spend the money for regular wine, we were immediately treated like aliens from another planet. The hotel, itself, is lovely and just as the pictures on this sight show. We were three adults in a room and very comfortable. Our son had a regular and very comfortable bed. We slept in a king bed. The room was clean and was lovely. Our requests for extra pillows, towels, etc. were met with a smile and immediately sent to our room. No problems at all. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant and always with smiles. They all spoke perfect English. The free internet was a plus. We decided to use taxis to travel to the many landmarks. We would have a taxi pick us up at the hotel and take us to a landmark. From there, we would walk to two or three other places, per day. We utilized a map of landmarks and make plans to visit certain places nearby each other each day. We then took a cab back to the hotel after the day was complete. It worked out perfectly. Probably a bit more expensive than taking the subway or hop on hop off bus but much more comfortable for us. The hotel is great is you want to get away from the madness of Rome at night. It is quiet and peaceful there at the Rivoli. Plus, we found that the price was great for the value. We loved it. So, if you want my recommendation, do not listen to all of the small talk about the problems at this hotel. It was worth the Euro and we were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the hotel. We had a great time in Rome and would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but?”
Reviews.Author: TonyL47
Reviews.Content: Nice room, well appointed, & the staff were very friendly, & helpful. But, if you wanted a shower, or shave at peak times, forget it! , the hot water was just not there. This hotel needs the services of a good plumber to sort things out. Other guests we met also complained.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but a little off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Kackers83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very good value. Free WiFi along with a nice complimentary breakfast. The room as comfortable and the staff was very friendly. Just a couple of draw backs......we did loose water in the room the first morning.....I think it was because everyone in the hotel was likely taking a shower at the same time. After calling the front desk, it was back on within a couple of minutes (seemed like this had happended before). Also, it is about a 20 minute walk to any site....not bad if you don't mind a nice stroll each day....but if you want to be in the center of things...this is not the place! Overall, comfortable stay and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable stay, good food,comfotable rooms and very obliging staff”
Reviews.Author: MELIN3915
Reviews.Content: I booked the Rivoli as a last minute holiday and didn't read the reviews until I had confirmed the booking. When I later browsed the Trip Advisor reviews I have to say I was worried as some people were quite negative regarding their stay at the hotel. So it was with a slightly uneasy feeling that we left for Rome at the end of July. When we arrived we were warmly welcomed by receptionist,Erica, who dealt with our accommodation very quickly and we were shown to our room. It was a ground floor room with a small patio area. The room looked recently refurbished and the walls were covered in a dark fabric, which wasn't an issue but the pattern on it constantly moved infront of my eyes and instantly made me feel dizzy. I approached reception about the situation and within 20 minutes we had been moved to a room with less busy walls. The bathroom was in black granite and sparkling white ceramicware and there was plenty of hot water at any time of the day. Both towels and sheets were changed daily and the room was spotlessly clean. There was also a"free" safe in the room, we've stayed in some hotels where there is a charge for this facility. The bed was comfortable and so were the pillows and the air conditioning worked well. We had a balcony with a table and chairs. The public areas in the hotel were very clean and the decoration was typically Italian, lots of marble and travertine. Breakfast was quite ample with bacon and scrambled eggs for those who wanted something hot. The continental breakfast included rolls and croissants, German rye bread and sliced bread for toasting, butter, jams and spreads, a selection of sliced cheese, ham and salami, cereals, yoghurt, cakes, fresh fruit and plum tomatoes, a selection of juices, tea and coffee. If you wanted something that wasn't on the table the staff were very obliging. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant as such but it does have a basic menu which can be ordered at the bar, handy if you've had a hard day's sightseeing and your feet are refusing to take you to one of the local restaurants. If you like pizza then walk down the hill and over the river to the RossoPomodoro which serves fab food at reasonable prices. For a more formal meal you could visit the Pargaroma restaurant which is up the hill from the Rivoli, two courses with drinks around 67 euros, excellent food and service. Back to the hotel - all staff were very helpful, especially when we were asking for directions and info. regarding public transport. They gave us names and directions to the local restaurants. To get into Rome centre the best way to travel is by the No. 52 bus, which arrives about every 20 mins. You will need to buy your tickets from the tobacconist shop near the Pargaroma, they cost 1 euro each and last for 75 mins. Remember to validate your ticket in the yellow machine when you get on the bus, if you don't you can have a fine. Overall we had a very comfortable stay at the Rivoli and feel we had very good value for money. We have stayed in more prestigious hotels in Italy and have had indifferent service and disappointing accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Does not worth more than 50€”
Reviews.Author: Bobanito
Reviews.Content: Value for money is very low. I paid € 80 but the room smelled of sewage (the smell probably came from the bathroom), the shower had no curtain, so I flooded the bathroom, the breakfast was very poor and the furniture worn and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding, but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Italiantourist2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Rivoli for a 3 night stay. Although it is far from major attractions in Ancient Rome, it is only a block or two from Bus #52, which takes you to the metro, and then you can get anywhere you'd like to go. It's in a very safe, more upscale neighborhood north of Borghese Gardens. The room was small, but clean. The shower temperature varied from extremely cold to very hot due to shared water heaters. It was fairly quiet at night. The staff was helpful in giving directions and recommendations, and spoke good English. Breakfast was a mix of European and American- pretty standard for Continental breakfast. The WiFi worked great, and the overall price was good. It lacks the charm and convenience of other places closer to the city center, but if you don't mind a few transportation connections and are on a budget, it isn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star by far !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ErkaBelgium
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood. Yes the hotel is close to a bus stop that will get you to the good Roman spots. Yes, I got a very low internet rate paying up front for this hotel but that is about it ! I booked a room for 3 persons as I was traveling with my 2 teenage daughters. Three person room in this hotel means a very small room with an extra bed put in. We ended up by putting the mattrass (that was in 3 pieces !) on the ground because it was impossible for my daughter to get a decent night of sleep on this so-called bed. The other beds were OK. The airconditioning made an awfull noise, impossible to go to sleep when it was turned on. And even with the air conditioning on it was still too warm in the room. When taking a shower the water was either too hot or too cold. Breakfast is served starting at 7am but you have to wait until 7.30 am before everything is on the buffet. The staff at reception is absolutely useless (with one exception !). When enquiring about restaurants to go to or any kind of information on public transportation they are being non responsive and not very helpful. If you look at the pictures on the website of the hotel... I think they were taken in another place and time ! Unless you want 2 star quality, keep away !

Reviews.Title: “Not such a good value”
Reviews.Author: Herpi
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quite small, room and bathroom too but it was clean and quiet. Wi-fi which is very important for me was really really bad! Breakfast was nice. But I was bit disappointed by the location. Although it was not far away from the station Euclide, trains were running every 10 min but if we wanted to come back to hotel in the evening, we had to leave the centre latest by 22.00. First night we didn't know that, we reached to metro stop Flaminio (metro running till midnight) and we found the suburban railway line closed, last train leaves at 22.40, it was more than 23.00 so we ended up spending 10EUR for cab. So it's best to book the hotel in Rome which is near one of the metro stops on line A or B, not the suburban lines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RoxanaH71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, together with another couple, went to Rome for Easter. It was our first vist to Rome and we booked BW Rivoli in advance- at a good rate, yet we were a bit anxious to see if the good reviews were to be confirmed. They all confirmed- and we had a very pleasant stay. One of the big advantages of the hotel is the quiet location, which is a big plus after spending a day in the very busy touristic areas of the city. At the same time, the acces to the city centre is very easy- just take bus 52 which stops just a few steps from the hotel and go to the end of the line, a 15 minutes trip. The hotel itself is small, cozy, nicely decorated and welcoming, with helpful reception staff and a romantic style. We had rooms 207 and 212- not too big, yet big enough and comfortable. The bathrooms were big, with shower and bath tub. The coffee & tea making facilities (kettle+ instant coffee & tea) were brought into the room on request, for free. A tough picker would say that there was one downside - the minibar in our room didn't work, but for us this wasn't really an issue, so we didn't even report it. The room was clean, bedsheets and towels were changed daily and looked immaculate. We found also useful that close to the hotel (just go down the main street, than turn second left) there was a supermarket (GDS- the Italian correspondent of Carrefour)- were you could find nice fruit, juice, mineral water, sweets etc- almost everything you could wish to "supplement" your staying. Breakfast is ok, but pretty much the same thing every day; still enough to choose from (usually 2 types of ham/ salami, cheese, sausages, eggs, various yogourts, jam, butter, fresh fruits, croissants, cakes, milk, cereals), coffe/cappuccino. Re internet access- we had our laptop with us and connected easily to the Wireless internet network using the password given by the reception staff. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay at Best Western Rivoli Hotel, would stay there again any time and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a good value for money stay in Rome! Probably not advisable to those seeking a very dynamic environment/ vecinities, nor to the very high-standard or modern style seekers.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel, out of town but easy bus ride in and pretty location.”
Reviews.Author: moty1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very pretty , great rooms, everything we asked for was sent up within minutes, including coffee and tea making facilities, loo paper and tea bags. always helpful at front desk with directions to tourist attractions. Quiet and pretty location. Easy to get to town. Nice big balcony . Decent breakfast. Clean and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: fatya
Reviews.Content: great hotel with great sevice. it also has wonderful scenery on the backyard!

Reviews.Title: “a great quiet and romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdiL4
Reviews.Content: at first I was a little afraid since the hotel isn't in the canter of the city. but when we got there, we figured that it's not that bad and you can get to the closest metro station in 20 minutes walking. the interior design of the hotel is georgeous and very romantic!! you actually fill like you live in ancient rome. I loved it and recommand to others!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly personnel, nice rooms, close to the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Perlita_8
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Rome at the end of September 2009. The hotel is located 1-2 kilometers walking distance from Piazza del Popolo, close to Villa Borghese. If you do not want to walk, there is public transportation at the door that takes you to Termini, subway or to the center. The hotel is very clean, our room was small (we did not care, we only slept there...), with a nice bathroom, tv , fridge and a beautiful balcony with a small table and chairs. the staff was very friendly and helpfull and the continental breakfast was excellent! I highly recommend the hotel, the area where is located is very nice and quiet. There are some nice restaurants and gelato places in walking distance and there is a good supermarket to buy some groceries.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: SteveCE
Reviews.Content: This is a run down hotel, in a dodgy sidestreet far from any tourist sites. The bathroom reeked as if in a sewer, 70s style decoration (and probably never been cleaned or touched up since then) in the rooms. Tacky hallway, and the staff didn't seem to care at all about their hotel/guests. No idea how this could ever be a 4 star hotel. The internet is supposedly free but I was informed at the desk that it was not possible now, maybe tomorrow, without any further explanation. We booked for three nights but fled after the first one and found a much better BW in Rome: Hotel Canada which costs less, is better situated and has staff that cares. Avoid this tourist trap at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad hotel, not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: FairyNicole
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in a good location, it is right next to the bus station which takes you right in the city center within a few minutes. The Hotel doesn't even look like a hotel from the outside, looks more like a normal building turned into a hotel. The hall is very small despite how it looks like on the pictures and there was only one elevator which was also very very small, only 2 people could walk in! That's why sometimes you need to wait for a long time to get into your room, or you can walk the stairs like we did (i need to walk 4 floors in a 4 star hotel??). The staff was great, nothing special but not rude. We got a superior room with balcony on the last floor and the view was beautiful. The room was big but really dirty (there was dust everywhere, even on top of the toilette paper!!) and smelled weird. There should have been free internet access so we asked the staff for the password in order to surf with our laptop, they gave the password to us but it wouldn't work! Now my boyfriend works as a computer technician so he couldn't have done something wrong. So we asked the stuff for some help and got told that they couldn't do anything about it! I don't think it's fair as we went to that hotel also because of the free internet! The breakfast was very poor for a 4 star hotel but was available till late and that's a plus for young tourists that go out till late at night. In conclusion i think this should be rated as a 2-3 star hotel, certainly not 4! It's an expensive hotel and it's not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Far from sights - Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: dools102
Reviews.Content: Started with walking 2 miles from the Pizzaz that was 'close by', up a major hill pulling luggage. Then told that the description on the internet was incorrect - 1 king 1 single 3 singles does not mean sleeping for 6, it means 1 king 1 single OR 3 single beds - mistake on their part that cost me another room. The other room for my children was located one floor down. Then there was the phone that kept ringing until I unplugged it at midnight - I was asked if someone was trying to call me?? Did not want to switch to a smelly room, so was left with no phone to contact the children. NEVER stay here - EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Really cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug_99_28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We caught a cab from the train station to the hotel for around 25 Euros. The hotel is small, but so cute and nicely decorated. We really felt like we were in Italy. There were nice paintings everywhere and our room was cosy. We had a corner room so we had a big balcony and a massive bathroom. The service was good, the person at the front desk was friendly showed us how to catch the bus and get around town, which we really appreciated. They also helped us call a cab for when we were leaving. The breakfast was nice too. It was small dining room with a nice range of hot and cold foods. Overall it was a pleasant experience and the hotel really made our first trip to Rome extra special! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again. the only down side was that it was a little far from the train station, but once you get there, its not far to even walk down town or to catch a bus (around 1 euro for a bus ride to down town, but be sure to purchase your tickets from a store in advance as the bus driver does not sell tickets).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Merhba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not that bad if you do not have a better budget or find availability in Rome. The quality is poor and the rooms do look nice at first impression until you look further. The water did not work on the first day and this must have been a reoccurring situation. The lift is small and not practical. The breakfast is poor and for Italy the coffee was bad! Hardly any taxis knew the place but for getting around my meetings it was not that bad. If you are in Rome on holiday and like a little extra conform look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Johanne_8
Reviews.Content: This was a good, clean hotel but a little far from downtown. It was clean but very small for the three people we were. When you ask for a triple room, they just add a cot to a double room. There is not a lot of space to move. Since we do not spend a lot of time in our room, it was pricy but ok. I will recommend it if you like to be outside of the tourist crowd and like to mixt with local. The service was ok , but like most of Rome hotel and restaurant, people do not smile to you and do not look very friendly. Get use to it in Rome. From Poppolo piazza it did cost 6 euro to take a taxi back to the hotel at night. Not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Such a shame”
Reviews.Author: beverleehills
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 11th to 18th.Feb Its a shame it is run down. We found the staff very nice though and friendly especially the bar guy Roland. The bar was hardly opened though and there was no food at all in the evenings. My husband hurt his foot and could not walk far towards the end of our holiday, so on the last night we asked for something to be sent to the hotel. They could not organise this. They made us up 2 stale sandwiches with stale ham and cheese and charged us 20 euros. Not going back again. Italy now is very expensive and not good value for money. We saw great increases since we were there last time 14 months ago.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: EnglandNana
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had to wait for our room with no apology. The room was very basic and there was no info on the hotel. We were told we would have to send our clothes to laundry and pay to have them ironed but on the day before we left the information folder apeared and we found out we could of had a iron and coffee making facilities which are basic things that you expect in a 4 star hotel. I could go on with the complaints so all i tell you is find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grimsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rivoli for 4 nights (Romantic weekend away following our recent wedding). The Hotel is down a pokey side street and has little to offer in the way of facilities. Luckily we found so much to do in Rome that we were hardly at the hotel. We ended up in a double (twin beds, we pushed them together but the cleaner kept seperating them...we took the hint) smoking room which smelt foul, the stale smell was impregnated in the fabric walls. The bath plughole leaked and there was little hot water. The bathroom was well overdue attention.When we went down for breakfast on our first morning we noticed that every single table was full of dirty dishes. I heard other English guests complaining that it was disgusting. There wasnt anything left to eat (if you do go, have breakfast early) the yoghurts (pretty much the only food left) were 2 months out of date!! I pointed this out and got no response from the waiter!!! not even an acknowledgement. The staff were so rude, we asked if we could change rooms due to the smell and were told NO. Eventually we gave up and vowed never to return. Having stayed in a number of 4 star hotels I would struggle to rate it with 3!!! Its not that close to the centre, and to be honest I cant think of anything nice to say about it. If you havent already booked...DONT!!! Rome is such a fantastic place although we did notice that we were always charged TAT (tourist added tax), make a note of how much things are before you ask/order them. I would never recomend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible bathrooms, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: petra82
Reviews.Content: We are a family and stayed there in two rooms, 801 and 802, for 5 nights. The bathrooms urgently need to be fixed. In our room, 802, not only the bathroom was old and looked dirty with stains of leak of water on the ceiling, but there was an ugly smell and water on the floor of the bathroom from a broken pipe.The rooms were spacious and sheets were changed everyday , together with towels, but the floor of the bathroom was not even once mopped. Breakfast was very poor and further more, plates and cups were overused . People working in the breakfast room were impolite. The hotel was supposed to be a four stars hotel but I would grade it two stars mostly.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: angela1111
Reviews.Content: Nothing really good to say about this hotel .Staff all seem to have an attitude problem. No safety boxes ,No resturaunt open, No do not disturb signs and as we were on honeymoon we were walked in on many a time .I have stayed at better 2 star hotels. Oh and the tea and coffee making facilities took 4 days to manage to get any.If you can change to another hotel ,if you have already booked ,I would strongly advise it

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read some of the negative reviews on this Hotel and was somewhat dismayed as I had already booked and paid for my stay. Perhaps that was a good thing, as it turned out to be a pleasant stay. Tea, Coffee making facilities are available for free upon request, ask at reception before heading for your room. Room was cleaned each day, fresh towels etc. Breakfast was basic with some weird cracker bread, croissants, cornflakes, tea coffee etc. All room amenities were in working order ie shower bath etc. Most staff were helpful speaking to me in English as I didn't know one word of Italian. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. The only negative...... the walls are far from sound proofed, so if you are going there for a Romantic weekend well lets just say, be careful otherwise the rest of the Hotel will hear you. Even worse you may end up having to listen to others if you catch my drift. There is a Metro 10 mins walk from Hotel "Euclide" by turning right out of the Hotel, right and then right again walk down to the end of this road cross over the road and left (for about 20 feet) then take right about 50 feet takes you to Euclide station. You can buy an all day Ticket for 4 Euros, which allows you on Metro, Bus and Tram as often as you like. The Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum etc are all only Metro stops away from each other. Rome is a great place to visit. REMEMBER LIKE ALL MAJOR CITIES HAVE A DEATH GRIP ON YOUR PURSE WALLET CAMERA ETC, especially when travelling on the Metro, the busier the train is (people squashed against each other) the greater the risk of being pick-pocketed. THEY WORK IN GROUPS!!!!. I almost lost my camera to some female who managed to get the zip opened on the camera case and get her hand on the camera. Luckily the train jerked and moved her away from me and I could then see what was going on. DONT LET THIS WORRY YOU, you'll have a great time just be VIGILANT.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel located in a quiet and safe neighborhood. More business-oriented than leisure-oriented. Many embassies in the nearby. Friendly staff. Adequate breakfast. Ask for rooms on the upper floors. Third floor is the best. Close to a couple of very good restaurants. Very close to the most important Park in Rome: Villa Borghese. Visit the Museo Borghese, a lovely place, and the National Gallery of Modern Art.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rivoli is in a very interesting part of Rome. If you want to experience what life in Rome is like for natives, then stay here. There are good, authentic places to eat and the hotel has a good view of the residential areas from the balcony. The hotel is directly next to a junior high which is sometimes noisy. As for the hotel itself, it is very average. The rooms are very small and the service is very average (breakfast was bad). The water in my shower would sometimes stop while I was showering and not come back on. There was no toilet paper and there was only one towel. There are better choices for the money

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Rivoli Hotel in the first week of June. Our room looked a little run-downed. Toilet didn’t work properly. Room was smaller than expected. Maid service was inconsistent and the air conditioning and fridge in room did not work. Front desk staff were not very customer oriented. Hotel is not conveniently located to major Rome attractions – you will have to take either a bus or a tram to get to most of the attractions in the inner city (from my experience, this could be from a 15 minute to 40 minute ride depending on the varying frequency of the public transportation). Had problems booking a room and making changes to the reservation – make sure that everything is in writing!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Rivoli
HotelInfo.Address: Via Torquato Taramelli 7, 00197 Rome, Italy
